title: Just for fun again, tell us a cool tip of your favorite champion ^.^
body:
Yasuo can auto before he ult's someone, when you've learned yasuo you cringe when someone ults right away xD

Edit: added another few Yasuo tips,

Yasuo can dash through pretty much all the jungle camps for a clean escape, this can be difficult to do though, and requires use of the "target champions only" mode

Always wait the full duration of an allies knockup before ulting, also dont be too quick to ult, finding the right time is essential

Yasuo can cancel his autos and abilities pretty well with each other, auto-Q-auto-E-auto, stuff like that

Since the recent update, Yasuo's tornado now applies on hit effects, this makes his laning a tad bit stronger if he gets an early shiv, its also good because it makes you hold your tornado longer to zone enemies, and also influences movement to build shiv stacks, also meaning flow stacks :)

As Gnar, once you hit Level 6 and have a full rage meter, E in, R the enemy into a wall, W them when the stun is over, and Q them when that stun is over.   You will normally be able to get a kill, while still having very safe CS and harass. Basically what I'm saying is that Gnar is OP.

Edit: Apparently people don't like my tip so I'll say something else.
As Jinx, if you see an enemy run away with low health under turret into a blind area, give them a second, then ult towards the enemy fountain. If you time it and aim correctly, you will get the kill.
He said "cool tip", not "the basic combo everyone does."

{{item:3725}}  on {{champion:48}} makes fighting near minion crowds really deceptive.  You can smite a group of minions for an instant heal that no one expects and causes the enemy team to second guess fighting you.
Only the Trundle passive will heal you, the ranger's trailblazer smite won't. Just for clarity.
that's why no one expects it
As Skarner, just before your ultimate ends turn around! You'll end up pulling them just a little bit farther this way!
As Jax once you hit 6 hit a creep twice then jump to your opponent and auto him to proc the ult passive.

As Diana your R's travel time is exactly the same amount of time it takes for your max range Q to travel. So if you're sure that your Q will hit you can R right away and get an instant reset on your ult. Also at lower elos when people are running from you with little to no health I find that I'm able to just throw out a max range Q and walk away, they tend to run right into the end of it lol.
{{champion:432}} jungle can do a "drive by" Baron or Dragon steal by using Magical Journey across the back wall of the pit and smiting halfway thru.
Nocturne can do it too, just way more situational :P
How exactly? I'm guessing he can ult over the top of Baron onto someone and smite while in flight.

yeah easiest way to show it is to have a ward in top tri bush, and a ward in baron pit. Have someone on enemy team standing in tri bush, and noc in the bush behind Red buff.  Noc ults to the person in tri and smites while briefly over the baron pit.

Have never actually pulled it off in a game, but I have seen videos of it happening.
Doesn't this mean any jungle can do this if there's a bard on the team?
As Lux you can, with good timing, do: Q>E>AA>E(Detonate)>R>AA for maximum damage. It always annoys me when people skip out on the AAs until after the ult. It wastes you passive's true potential!

But fun fact.

Lux's ult ignites the passive and places the passive again which then you can change it to

Q > E > R > AA > Detonate E > AA for more damage then what you have above
If you look, the total damage is exactly the same, it's just the above combo is better because you don't need to wait for your autoattack timer for the second auto.

{{champion:16}} - Sick of the fearful feeling you get when using Soraka, due to her lack of survivability when she gets ganked? Fear no more! If you see the enemies chasing you down, and you have your silence up, place it in front of where you are already running to, so that while they chase you, they have no choice but to either run into your Equinox and end up silenced as well as stunned, or have to run around, saving you a few seconds that could just be the deciding factor as to whether or not you survive!

{{champion:99}}  Her Q has a small cast time before the projectile comes out, so if you're trying to catch someone off guard, you can press Q, then flash. If you do it right, the Q will launch from your new location with your opponent having minimal reaction time.
why would you do that...

It's a lot harder to dodge when you do it that way.
People also use it alot with Ahri E.

You can also hit your skills that way from a location where the skill would be blocked. For example, using a skill and flashing over the minion wave.
And if your skill misses, you just blew your flash for absolutely no reason
That's the beauty of it. Risk and reward. Almost like you have to be good to do it!

The mistake I see the most with {{champion:31}} in lane is not starting E...

Malphite has one of the safest jungle clears, and once you have a couple of items, he stops taking damage from the small camps entirely.

{{champion:43}} Use Karma's Ult-W a lot more! I always see people just spamming Ult-Q as soon as it's off cooldown, but her Ult-W is ridiculously powerful. It's like a Fiddlesticks drain, except with a snare, twice the damage, you can cast your other abilities, AND you can move while casting it! Although she has better combos for teamfights, her Ult-W is great for dueling or if you're caught with bad positioning. I find it very fun to use while fed especially.

I'll share a couple for a few of my favorites. 

As {{champion:115}}, there are two distinct playstyles that you can use to adapt to your enemy. If they've got a short ranged assassin or burst mage that can easily all in you, {{champion:238}} or {{champion:1}}  for example, keep your distance and poke with your range. Don't go anywhere near them, even to use your passive. A bit of extra damage isn't worth you dying for. Basically just always keep your distance, and stay in the back line. The second is to use against other long ranged champions, champions like {{champion:101}} or {{champion:161}}. With this you're going to be in their face, tossing autos between Q's and doing your best to dodge their spells. Your passive will help you win trades even if you get hit by the enemies spells. 

As {{champion:43}}  top lane, you'll often run into champions that, after an MR item or two, you straight up can't kill. Champions like {{champion:86}} {{champion:3}} {{champion:57}}. but that doesn't mean you don't still counter them. It's not all about killing them, it's about making sure you're farming well while they're not. So even if it seems like you'll run OOM before you kill them, keep harassing at all times. If done well, I assure you you'll have at least double their farm by the end of lane phase. For squishier laners, it often takes only one ulted Q to make them think twice about staying in lane. Once they back, be sure to look out for their return and slap them with an ulted Q as they're walking back to lane. And last but not least, Karma is deceptively durable for the amount of damage and lack of tank items she builds. Playing her as a poke/kite mage is all about looking like an easy kill, then dancing out of their reach with slows, snares, and your shield and MS buff. Poke them when they refuse to engage on you, kill them when they engage on you. Don't be afraid to fight under enemy tower. 

As {{champion:143}}  mid lane always throw a Q and a seed between the casters and melee minions when your enemy gets near for farm. Doing this either keeps them away from farming or they take free damage. Much like Karma top, you can easily fight under enemy towers. Use your superior range and plants to do damage from beyond the tower's range, or within it and have your plants tank for you. Again, like Karma top, if you see an enemy coming back into lane after backing, slap them with a full combo. They often don't see it coming and get hit by both the Q and E, then are forced to tank two plants for as long as they're snared. Try to avoid Athene's and other heavy mana items. Her early game is difficult to manage her mana, but her mana scaling is good enough that mid to late game you can spam comfortably with just a morellos. Keep in mind that her Q plant has range, but her E plant has slows. It's often good to do one of each, but two E plants is usually not a good idea. Two Q plants is okay, but not two E plants. When using your ult, even plants you spawn after the initial cast will be buffed. When using your ult, it's often a good idea to fight inside of it, even if that means dying. The knock up leads to an easy passive, and the buffed plants combined with your passive will nearly always be enough to kill. Last but not least, if you know you're going to die, try to land a double planted snare right before you do. The snare combined with slowing plants leads to a near unmissable passive.

{{champion:90}}  can charge his passive in base by taking Q at level 1. You can get an early voidling with this trick and potentially cheese a 1.5v1 at level 1. You can also use Q and W to get 2 (or 2 more) charges on your passive before heading back to lane.

As {{champion:67}}, if you tumble against a wall the tumble animation is extremely short and the reset auto comes out almost immediately.

His E-Q combo is  a self pull. This means that you can escape while rooted.

{{champion:21}} if someone is running away from you, her E (Make it Rain) has a really high range so you can slow them, they won't take the full duration but it can definitely allow you to catch up to them and kill them if you use it right.

Oh and people use a combo like W > AA > Q > AA but due to her Q being an auto attack reset, while you're using the auto attack reset the W bonus Attack Speed is useless. So doing AA > Q > AA > W is better.

Put health shrines in places at start of jungling path to help jungle at start of game. You can do this before laning, back for your mana, and reach lane full of mana, while helping jungle.

Q takes practice to land well, keep trying. Also, if enemy is chasing you through Magical Journey, the Q is a quick stun.

Look for the longest stretches of wall in map. I've saved teammates, gotten kills, and just downright surprised both teams by how long some of these journeys can go. Also, it's good for its (essential) invincibility. Journeying through a turret when 3 ganked bot secured a kill due to that stall. Still died though.

Lastly, look up a chart with all the meep upgrades. The totem spawns are pretty important for late game, and carrying capacity is important for fights. You shouldn't leave your adc all the time, obviously, but you should realize when you could get a spawn upgrade for faster upgrades.

Also, ult is pure skill. The safe and easy choice is using it to just disable turrets for a dive. But if you're trying to land champs, it requires a bunch of skill there, and can make or break fights.
rush rhylais on cho and a w will slow and keep them from dashing making your q almost impossible to miss
As Quinn, while having your ult active, you can activate your ultimate again for the execute, mid E dash and bounce off your target still dealing the damage from your skystrike.

Many people say that {{champion:102}}'s weakness is her inability to gank early cause of a lack of cc, but once you get bilgewater cutlass and chilling smite, the chain slow is more than enough to take down an opponent. Sometimes, I like to take exhaust instead of flash cause Shyv is already mobile as hell and exhaust helps with chasing and dueling.
